data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the configuration and metadata of a specific index within a data entity. Returns the index definition including field mappings and settings. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (View index details or Master Data administrator role).

Added context about return value (index definition, field mappings, settings) and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding of when this operation can be used.

message: Operation 'Deleteindexbyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about side effects (impact on query performance) and the permanent nature of deletion. data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific index from a data entity. This operation removes the index configuration and will impact query performance for searches that relied on this index. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Remove index or Master Data administrator role). This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about side effects (impact on query performance) and the permanent nature of deletion. Added context about consequences and permission requirements to help AI agents understand the implications of this destructive operation.

message: Operation 'Validatedocumentbyclusters' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original description lacks clarity about inputs (cluster rules format) and outputs (validation results). Added context about the five-rule limit, what the operation returns, use cases, and permission requirements. Enhanced summary to be more specific about the operation's purpose for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Checks if a document is present in one or more clusters (specific set of field values).

>ℹ️ There is a limit of five rules per request.
data.summary_suggestion: Check document membership in field value clusters
data.description_suggestion: Validates whether a document matches one or more cluster definitions (specific combinations of field values). Accepts up to five cluster rules per request. Returns validation results indicating which clusters the document belongs to. Useful for data quality checks and document categorization. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original description lacks clarity about inputs (cluster rules format) and outputs (validation results). Added context about the five-rule limit, what the operation returns, use cases, and permission requirements. Enhanced summary to be more specific about the operation's purpose for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Listversions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about pagination, return format, and what version metadata is included. Added context about automatic versioning behavior, pagination support, and what information is returned to help AI agents understand how to retrieve and process document history.

data.current_description:
Lists the versions of a document.

>ℹ Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all versions for a specific document. Each version represents a state change of the document. Returns version metadata including version IDs, timestamps, and change information. Master Data automatically creates a new version for each document modification. Supports pagination parameters to control result size and offset.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about pagination, return format, and what version metadata is included. Added context about automatic versioning behavior, pagination support, and what information is returned to help AI agents understand how to retrieve and process document history.

message: Operation 'Getversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic and doesn't specify 'by ID'. Description lacks clarity about what is returned (complete document state) and use cases. Added context about the document state at that version, practical use cases (auditing, comparison, restoration), and clarified that this retrieves a specific version snapshot.

data.current_description:
Returns the version of a document.

>ℹ Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve specific document version by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific version of a document by version ID. Returns the complete document state as it existed in that version, including all fields and their values at that point in time. Useful for auditing changes, comparing versions, or restoring previous document states. Master Data automatically creates a new version for each document modification.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't specify 'by ID'. Description lacks clarity about what is returned (complete document state) and use cases. Added context about the document state at that version, practical use cases (auditing, comparison, restoration), and clarified that this retrieves a specific version snapshot.

message: Operation 'Putversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Update version' is ambiguous - unclear if it updates version metadata or restores to a version. Description 'Updates the document's version value' is vague about what this means operationally. Added clarity that this is a restoration/promotion operation, specified that it requires request body input, clarified that it creates a new version entry, and added permission context for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Updates the document's version value.

>ℹ Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.summary_suggestion: Restore or promote document to specific version
data.description_suggestion: Updates a document to a specific version state, effectively restoring or promoting the document to a previous or target version. Accepts version data in the request body and updates the document's current state to match the specified version. This operation creates a new version entry reflecting the restoration action. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Insert or update document, Full access, or Master Data administrator role).
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Update version' is ambiguous - unclear if it updates version metadata or restores to a version. Description 'Updates the document's version value' is vague about what this means operationally. Added clarity that this is a restoration/promotion operation, specified that it requires request body input, clarified that it creates a new version entry, and added permission context for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Scrolldocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism. Description lacks clarity on what is returned (response structure) and doesn't emphasize the token-based pagination pattern. Improved summary uses 'paginated' and 'scroll token' to clarify the operation's purpose. Enhanced description explains the token lifecycle, return values, and when to use this endpoint for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Returns a list of documents according to query parameter filters. If you need to query the entire database, or your collection is over 10000 documents, use this endpoint.

In the first request, the `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` token will be obtained in the response header. This token must be passed to the next request in the `_token` query string parameter. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity, and each request made with the token during this time resets the expiration timer.

After the token is obtained, it is no longer necessary to send the filter or document size per page parameters. You only need to resend the token until the document collection is empty.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve paginated documents using scroll token
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of documents from a data entity using cursor-based pagination. Supports filtering via query parameters. On the first request, returns an `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` header that must be passed as the `_token` query parameter in subsequent requests to continue pagination. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity. Use this endpoint for querying entire databases or collections exceeding 10,000 documents. Returns a list of documents matching the filter criteria and a continuation token for the next page.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Scroll documents' is too generic and doesn't convey the pagination mechanism. Description lacks clarity on what is returned (response structure) and doesn't emphasize the token-based pagination pattern. Improved summary uses 'paginated' and 'scroll token' to clarify the operation's purpose. Enhanced description explains the token lifecycle, return values, and when to use this endpoint for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Saveschemabyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return values and doesn't explicitly state the idempotent nature of the operation. Improved summary uses 'Create or update' to clarify the operation's dual purpose. Enhanced description explains the create-or-update behavior, the 60-schema limit, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Creates or edits a data entity schema. Learn more about [Master Data schemas](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/master-data-schema-lifecycle). 

> Note that if you send a `schemaName` that does not exist for that data entity, this request will create it.

This request can also be used to [create or edit Master Data v2 triggers](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/setting-up-triggers-in-master-data-v2). 

> Each Master Data v2 data entity can have up to 60 schemas.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update data entity schema
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new schema or updates an existing schema for a data entity. If the specified `schemaName` does not exist, it will be created; otherwise, the existing schema will be updated. This operation can also be used to create or edit Master Data v2 triggers. Note that each data entity can have a maximum of 60 schemas. Returns the created or updated schema definition. Requires Master Data administrator permissions.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Save schema by name' is vague and doesn't clearly indicate create-or-update semantics. Description lacks clarity on return values and doesn't explicitly state the idempotent nature of the operation. Improved summary uses 'Create or update' to clarify the operation's dual purpose. Enhanced description explains the create-or-update behavior, the 60-schema limit, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Putindices' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_input_details. Original summary 'Create index' is incomplete - the PUT method typically indicates create-or-update semantics, not just create. Description is too minimal and lacks context about what indices do, what inputs are expected, and what is returned. Improved summary clarifies the create-or-update behavior. Enhanced description explains the purpose of indices, expected input structure, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

data.summary_suggestion: Create or update data entity index
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new index or updates an existing index for a data entity. Indices improve query performance by optimizing field lookups. Accepts an index configuration object specifying the fields to index and index type. Returns the created or updated index definition. Requires appropriate index management permissions.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create index' is incomplete - the PUT method typically indicates create-or-update semantics, not just create. Description is too minimal and lacks context about what indices do, what inputs are expected, and what is returned. Improved summary clarifies the create-or-update behavior. Enhanced description explains the purpose of indices, expected input structure, return value, and permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Createorupdatepartialdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create and update. Description lacks clarity about dual functionality (create vs update), missing output details about what is returned, and doesn't explain the partial update behavior clearly for AI agents deciding between this and other document operations.

data.current_description:
This request allows you to partially update a document corresponding to a given data entity.

>ℹ️ You can use this request to create documents for any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with auto-generated ID or partially updates an existing document in a data entity. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields remain unchanged. Supports any data entity and flexible field schemas. Returns the created or updated document with its ID and metadata.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Create partial document' is ambiguous - it doesn't clarify that this can both create and update. Description lacks clarity about dual functionality (create vs update), missing output details about what is returned, and doesn't explain the partial update behavior clearly for AI agents deciding between this and other document operations.

message: Operation 'Getdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate, but description is too brief and lacks output details. Missing explicit mention of what is returned (document object with metadata), and the field filtering capability should be more prominently explained as a key feature for AI agents to understand response customization options.

data.current_description:
Retrieves a document by ID.

>ℹ️ Assign the `_fields` parameter in the query string to retrieve the desired fields. If you want to return all the fields use `_fields=_all`.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a document from a data entity by its ID. Use the `_fields` query parameter to specify which fields to return; use `_fields=_all` to retrieve all fields. Returns the document object with requested fields and metadata. Supports field filtering to optimize response payload.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description is too brief and lacks output details. Missing explicit mention of what is returned (document object with metadata), and the field filtering capability should be more prominently explained as a key feature for AI agents to understand response customization options.

message: Operation 'Searchdocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic. Description is verbose but lacks clarity on key capabilities and output format. Missing explicit mention of pagination behavior, query parameter usage, and the relationship between search filters and returned data. AI agents need clearer guidance on query syntax options and pagination handling.

data.current_description:
Retrieves Master Data v2 documents' information, while choosing which fields will be returned and filtering documents by specific fields.

> The response header `REST-Content-Range` indicates the total amount of results for that specific search. For example, it may return `resources 0-100/136108`, which indicates it has returned the first 100 results out of a total of 136108.

Below you can see some query examples and learn more about each query parameter.

Learn more about [Pagination in the Master Data API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/pagination-in-the-master-data-api).

>⚠️ Avoid sending too many requests with wildcards (`*`) in the search parameters or that use the `keyword` parameter. This may lead to this endpoint being temporarily blocked for your account. If this happens you will receive an error with status code `503`.
data.summary_suggestion: Search and filter documents with field selection
data.description_suggestion: Searches documents in a data entity using flexible filtering and returns selected fields. Supports complex queries with filters, date ranges, numeric ranges, partial matches, null checks, and comparison operators. Returns paginated results with `REST-Content-Range` header indicating total count. Use `_fields` parameter to specify returned fields. Avoid excessive wildcard searches to prevent rate limiting (503 errors).
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description is verbose but lacks clarity on key capabilities and output format. Missing explicit mention of pagination behavior, query parameter usage, and the relationship between search filters and returned data. AI agents need clearer guidance on query syntax options and pagination handling.
